original_data.question: An immunology expert is delivering a talk on innate immunity. While talking about inflammasomes, he describes the process via an example: products of cellular stress are detected by NLRP3, which includes NOD-, LRR-, and pyrin domain-containing 3; the latter interacts with apoptosis-associated speck-like protein containing CARD (ASC) via the pyrin domain, which leads to the formation of a protein speck that consists of multimers of ASC dimers. Which of the following enzymes will be activated as the next step in the process?

model_response:
The process described is the formation of an inflammasome, which will activate caspase 1 to generate the biologically active form of IL-1. Inflammasomes are multiprotein complexes that assemble in the cytoplasm in response to a variety of stimuli and activate caspase-1, which cleaves a precursor form of interleukin-1 (IL-1) to generate the biologically active form. The NLRP3 inflammasome, which is expressed in myeloid cells and epithelial cells, consists of the NLRP3 sensor, the adaptor protein ASC, and caspase-1. The other enzymes listed are not involved in this process.

Answer: OPTION B IS CORRECT.</s><s>

question_entities.definition: The study of the immune system and its reaction to pathogens, as well as its malfunctions (autoimmune diseases, allergies, rejection of organ transplants).
Communication through a system of conventional vocal symbols.
Innate immune responses are defense responses mediated by germline encoded components that directly recognize components of potential pathogens. [GO_REF:0000022, GOC:add, GOC:ebc, GOC:mtg_sensu]
Communication through a system of conventional vocal symbols.
Multiprotein complexes that mediate the activation of CASPASE-1. Dysregulation of inflammasomes has also been linked to a number of autoinflammatory and autoimmune disorders.
Articles of food which are derived by a process of manufacture from any portion of carcasses of any animal used for food (e.g., head cheese, sausage, scrapple).
Cellular or subcellular processes involved with significant disturbance from a homeostatic condition. (NCI)
The measurement of the specified component / analyte, organism or clinical sign above the limit of detection of the performed test or procedure.
This gene plays a role in both inflammation and apoptosis.
NACHT, LRR and PYD domains-containing protein 2 (1062 aa, ~121 kDa) is encoded by the human NLRP2 gene. This protein plays a role in signaling pathways involved in apoptosis and inflammation.
This gene plays a role in the regulation of apoptosis.
The study of the heart, its physiology, and its functions.
This gene plays a role in the regulation of apoptosis.

A protein interaction domain of the death domain superfamily. It is characterized by a 6-helix bundle similar to those that occur in DEATH DOMAIN RECEPTORS. Pyrin domains are present in a variety of proteins, especially those that function in INFLAMMASOMES; AUTOPHAGY; and APOPTOSIS. They form homodimers or heterodimers with death domain proteins to facilitate the assembly of signaling complexes.

The chemical reactions and pathways resulting in the formation of substances; typically the energy-requiring part of metabolism in which simpler substances are transformed into more complex ones. [GOC:curators, ISBN:0198547684]

Linear POLYPEPTIDES that are synthesized on RIBOSOMES and may be further modified, crosslinked, cleaved, or assembled into complex proteins with several subunits. The specific sequence of AMINO ACIDS determines the shape the polypeptide will take, during PROTEIN FOLDING, and the function of the protein.
This gene is involved in the storage of coagulation factor V/Va in platelets.
This gene plays a role in the regulation of apoptosis.
compound formed by the union of two radicals or two molecules of a simpler compound; a polymer formed from two molecules of a monomer.

Biological molecules that possess catalytic activity. They may occur naturally or be synthetically created. Enzymes are usually proteins, however CATALYTIC RNA and CATALYTIC DNA molecules have also been identified.
To cause something to start or to stimulate activity.
